title: Bug 10403: Project creation confirmation for scrubbing bin directory
description: When creating a new project for an existing directory structure, there is a need to confirm the ability to delete and rebuild the output directory, especially when users set the output folder to a bin directory that may contain more than just .class files.
OB: No confirmation or warning is displayed when attempting to create a project with the output folder set to a bin directory that contains additional files beyond .class files.
EB: Upon project creation, there should be a confirmation prompt ensuring that the bin directory, if chosen as the output folder, can be safely deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
1. Open the application and navigate to the project creation wizard.
2. Select an existing directory structure as the project location.
3. Set the output folder to a bin directory containing various files, not just .class files.
4. Complete the project creation process.
5. Observe the absence of a confirmation prompt regarding the ability to scrub the bin directory.
6. Expected: A confirmation dialog should appear, ensuring the user's awareness of the bin directory's contents and the ability to delete and rebuild it.
